Authors: Gregorio Delgado, Sayaka Ban, Moriya Ohkuma, Gen Okada
Title:
A molecular phylogenetic assessment of four Endocalyx species
(anamorphic Cainiaceae, Xylariales) with the proposal of E. grossus
comb. et stat. nov.
Abstract:
A first attempt to infer the phylogenetic affinities of
four representative Endocalyx species based on nuclear ribosomal RNA
gene (nrDNA) sequence data is presented. Phylogenetic analyses using
partial sequences of the small and large subunits as well as the
complete ITS region suggest that strains representing three Endocalyx
species, E. cinctus, E. indumentum and E. melanoxanthus, the latter
including two varieties (E. melanoxanthus var. melanoxanthus and E.
melanoxanthus var. grossus) belong to the order Xylariales
(Sordariomycetes) where they form a strongly supported monophyletic
lineage within the family Cainiaceae. Species status is proposed for E.
melanoxanthus var. grossus under the name E. grossus comb. et stat. nov.
based on distinct morphological, cultural, ecological and molecular
evidence. The generic type species, E. thwaitesii, was not included in
the analyses since molecular data or cultures are not available yet and
therefore the genus status still requires further refinement. The
putative placement of Endocalyx within the family Apiosporaceae
(Xylariales), based on the presence of basauxic conidiogenesis, is
tentatively rejected as these species clustered within a different
family although within the same order. This mode of conidiogenesis is
determined to have evolved independently within unrelated or distant
ascomycetous lineages.
